docs.text: what a contrast !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the space of two days , i saw shakespeare in love and hurlyburly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm not sure you could get two more different movies .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while the former was all over the top , telegraphing everything , shoving its philosophy of life down our throats , hurlyburly was the complete opposite , wound so tight and with so much buried in its script , one could spend weeks thinking about it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is one interesting movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's very much in a similar vein to one of my favourite movies of '98 , in the company of men , although not quite so nasty .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's lots of talking and some scary insights into the world of men .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hurlyburly doens't contain much plot : we just follow eddie ( sean penn ) around as he tries to make sense of his life and the people around him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his big question is : does it all pertain to him ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and if it does , how is he supposed to feel about it all ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " it " means everything : television , friends , events that happen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i guess it could be summed up more crudely as : what's it all about ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is not a movie for answers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: donna ( anna paquin ) gives some but they're not really satisfying : they just lead to more questions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's what makes this movie stay on your mind .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: these are the sorts of questions that occupy our time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even when we push them to the background , however we resolve these questions influences everything we do .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the performances are all superb in hurlyburly .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i haven't seen sean penn in much before ( in fact , i can't remember seeing him in anything ) , but he is brilliant in this .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: eddie isn't a likeable character , but sean penn makes him understandable .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i don't want to be his friend but i'd like to help him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: chazz palminteri is also great as phil , making him an awful person .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'd never want to know phil but still i understand why eddie wants to be his friend .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everyone in this film nails their performances , making this world real .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a nasty world ; it's a sexist world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: unlike shakespeare in love which is unfailingly politically correct , hurlyburly is a man's world , seen unapologetically through the eyes of men .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i find this fascinating and on two counts , depressing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: first , it's depressing that such a world exists .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a large part of hurlyburly's success is that it convinces me that such people are real and that this sort of environment exists every day in hollywood ; that there are a large number of men out there who believe women to be completely peripheral to their world , toys , playthings .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sure , everyone is background to everyone else but in this world , women are a long way in the background .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: second , these are the movies that are being made : stories about men's world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where are the stories about women's world ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not the soap operas and the " chick flicks " that are meant to satisfy women , but the real stories that touch on the essence of life like hurlyburly does for men .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hurlyburly is based on a stage play and that is evident from the moment the film starts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's very talkative , intelligent and static .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while this can make the film drag a bit , and people sometimes sound like they're quoting textbooks , mostly this is a good thing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not all films have to be filled with special effects and sweeping panoramas .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not all films have to underestimate the intelligence of their audience .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all it means is that hurlyburly is probably just as effective on video as it is on the large screen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it also means that you have to pay attention .
docs.label: negative
